definitions.definition: a hand tool, power tool, or machine with a rotating cutting tip or reciprocating hammer or chisel, used for making holes.
examples: drilling tool, boring tool, auger, (brace and) bit, gimlet, awl, bradawl a hydraulic drill

definitions.definition: a tool used by a dentist for cutting away part of a tooth before filling it.
instruction or training in military exercises.
intensive instruction or training in something, typically by means of repeated exercises.
examples: tables can be mastered by drill and practice

definitions.definition: a rehearsal of the procedure to be followed in an emergency.
the correct or recognized procedure or way of doing something.
a predatory mollusk that bores into the shells of other mollusks in order to feed on the soft tissue.
produce (a hole) in something by or as if by boring with a drill.
examples: drill holes through the tiles for the masonry pins

definitions.definition: make a hole in (something) by boring with a drill.
examples: a power tool for drilling wood

definitions.definition: make a hole in or through something by using a drill.
examples: do not attempt to drill through a joist

definitions.definition: sink a borehole in order to obtain a certain substance, typically oil or water.
examples: they are licensed to drill for oil in the area

definitions.definition: (of a dentist) cut away part of (a tooth) before filling it.
(of a sports player) hit, throw, or kick (a ball or puck) hard and in a straight line.
examples: Rose drilled a ball deep to right center

definitions.definition: subject (someone) to military training exercises.
examples: a sergeant was drilling new recruits
synonyms: put someone through their paces "a sergeant drilling new recruits"

definitions.definition: (of a person) take part in military training exercises.
instruct (someone) in something by the means of repeated exercises or practice.
examples: I reacted instinctively because I had been drilled to do just that

definitions.definition: cause (someone) to learn something by repeating it regularly.
examples: his mother had drilled into him the need to pay for one's sins
synonyms: brainwash "his mother had drilled politeness into him"

definitions.definition: a machine that makes small furrows, sows seed in them, and then covers the sown seed.
a small furrow, especially one made by a drill.
a ridge with a furrow on top made by a drill.
a row of plants sown in a furrow made by a drill.
(of a person or machine) sow (seed) with a drill.
plant (the ground) in furrows.
examples: accurate ridging and drilling make hoeing much easier

definitions.definition: a dark brown baboon with a short tail and a naked blue or purple rump, found in the rain forests of West Africa.
a coarse twilled cotton or linen fabric.
